definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)

sentences.english: Many Japanese regarded him as the ablest Chinese strategist alive.
sentences.chinese: 許多日本人都認爲他是中國現有的最有才幹的戰略家。

sentences.english: I need one more stamp before my col-lection is completed.
sentences.chinese: 還需一枚郵票我的郵冊才幹被集完。

sentences.english: You must you dorm together before you leave.
sentences.chinese: 你必需先拾掇好宿舍才幹分開。

sentences.english: In old society many talented young people were too often ploughed under.
sentences.chinese: 在舊社會許多有才幹的青年常被埋沒。

sentences.english: She is the ablest girl I've ever met.
sentences.chinese: 她是我見到過的最有才幹的姑娘。

sentences.english: Faultfinding is one talent that ought to be buried.
sentences.chinese: 吹毛求疵是人們必須埋沒的一個才幹。

sentences.english: Remember to learn something new everyday, constantly summarize, reflect and improve.
sentences.chinese: 記住，溫故知新才幹有所提高。

sentences.english: Having the ability to adapt is one of the greatest strengths an entrepreneur can have.
sentences.chinese: 適應能力是企業家所能擁有的最強大的才幹之一。

sentences.english: Many optimists I know are quick to point out that others have talents superior to theirs.
sentences.chinese: 我認識的許多樂觀主義者會很快指出其他人更有才幹。

sentences.english: Ability and hard work cinched his success.
sentences.chinese: 才幹與努力保證了他的成功。

sentences.english: The most brilliant leadership can be mired in detail.
sentences.chinese: 最有才幹的領導也會陷於拘泥瑣事的困境中。

sentences.english: How long does it take to learn to shuffle?
sentences.chinese: 需要多長時間才幹學好墨爾本曳步舞呢？

sentences.english: The young surgeon showed exceptional competence.
sentences.chinese: 這位年輕的外科醫生具有不尋常的才幹。
人人都知道她很有才幹。

sentences.english: It requires no small talent to be a deciding bear.
sentences.chinese: 要成爲一個神憎鬼厭的人物，要有非同小可的才幹。

sentences.english: Kinglony 's success depends on talent excellence, dedicated staff.
sentences.chinese: 金隆的成功，有賴才幹卓越，盡心盡力的員工。

definition: to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view/acute foresight
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
